info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 3:45AM CDT until May 27 at 8:37AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Muddy Boggy Creek near Farris affecting Atoka County.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Muddy Boggy Creek near Farris.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 44.0 feet, Low-lying farmlands... pastures... and rural roads are flooded to depths of one foot in southeastern Atoka County. Valley areas closest to the creek may be isolated by water in side channels.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 35.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 43.0 feet. - Forecast...The Muddy Boggy Creek is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 44.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 43.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW MORNING
